Description.val:
The Long Range Anti-Ship Missile (LRASM) is a near-term solution for the Offensive Anti-Surface Warfare (OASuW) air-launch capability gap that will provide flexible, long-range, advanced, anti-surface capability against high-threat maritime targets.  The Navy is the lead service for the LRASM program.  

The missile is developed based on JASSM-ER (Joint Air-to-Surface Standoff Missile-Extended Range). Early operational capability for the LRASM is slated for 2018 on the U.S. Air Force B-1 Lancer and 2019 on the U.S. Navy F/A-18E/F Super Hornet.

The Department will transition the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA)/Office of Naval Research (ONR) LRASM demonstration design into a fielded weapon system which will support an increased offensive strike capability with an Early Operational Capability (EOC) in 2018 for Air Force platforms and 2019 on Navy platforms.  FY17 was the first year of LRASM procurement and the program procures missiles over a three year period. 

Funding for this exhibit is contained in PE 0207325F, LRASM 
Additional production funding for this exhibit is also contained in Navy PE 0604786N Offensive Anti-Surface Warfare Weapon Dev

Justification.val: The funds in FY18 will procure 15 LRASM missiles.
